tweets.text:
Still in shock, thankfully we evacuated elderly family members in time thanks to @LondonFire. Never witnessed this kind of flooding in our area before

Hoping that @Hillingdon @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency can clear the riverways ASAP so we can return to our homes safely!

Please share https://t.co/6Sjkqt7Ceh

domain.name: Ongoing News Story
domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text:
Severe flooding in the west Drayton area - levels never before seen by residents.

Over 50 homes evacuated majority elderly - disaster during #COVID

Blockages in river colne and Frays river the root cause

Let's hope @Hillingdon @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency can clear the riverways https://t.co/SWw7fk7DfJ

So who is going to step forward and take responsibility for the appalling state of the River Nene just to the East of Peterborough city centre? Sunken boats, piles of litter, collapsing banks @PeterboroughCC @EnvAgencyAnglia @PboroughMatters @peterboroughtel @PeterboroughCS

1.45pm, Sunday

Several flood alerts and three flood warnings still in place across the South East...

Keep up with the latest news, and for advice on what to do if flooding is possible or happens: https://t.co/u2DA9gft2p

You can also call Floodline: 0345 988 1188
#floodaware https://t.co/w6AGywVCT6

‚ö†Ô∏è A @EnvAgency Flood Alert is now in force for The River Tove around the #Towcester area. https://t.co/sctsKgILfT

Utter disgrace. Just back in from a long day out and couldn‚Äôt be less surprised to see these figures. Incontinent water companies continue to leak water, sewage and dividends all over the place. https://t.co/8oAWPXBhjZ https://t.co/SN9eLOMBzl

tweets.text:
@AnnelieseDodds Hi - Like many in Oxford today we are flooded - but we also have the joy of foul water mixing with rainwater run off, that @thameswater say could not be happening. They've blamed us, @OxfordCity and @EnvAgency for 15 years - ignoring their own engineers.
Pls help https://t.co/qIo8vgJMF3

tweets.text: ‚ÄúThe @EnvAgency and [environment department] should both hang their heads in shame, because it is they that have allowed the water companies to get away with this shocking performance.‚Äù #water companies receive worst pollution ratings for 8 years  https://t.co/mwpJY2U63g via @FT

We‚Äôve got teams out monitoring river levels and operating flood risk management assets in the @EnvAgencyYNE region today. Here‚Äôs the current flow rate at our #Ripon Dam asset in #NorthYorkshire. #TeamEA #Incidentresponse #floodriskmanagement #floodaware #plan #prepare #respond https://t.co/EdTePD27ye

Couple of rainy days & most of the paths are underwater. Wonder if it would help if @Hanson_UK actually maintained the river and cleared the ditches, instead of spending 5 years arguing with the @EnvAgency over who‚Äôs responsible? https://t.co/wXPsZSxm83

@LDNWaterkeeper @TheoJThomas As @ThamesCSOAlerts makes clear, untreated sewage goes into the river every time it rains. Yet this is meant to happen on exceptional circumstances only. These are all pollution incidents but @thameswater isn‚Äôt prosecuted; the @EnvAgency just lets it happen

Thames Water had the most serious pollution incidents last year - 15. This was an increase on 2018.
Across the sector there was little change. Despite this the number of formal cautions fell to zero in 2019 compared to 22 five years ago.
https://t.co/3vZoowaYF1
1/3

Rower notification from Thames Water: ¬†Hammersmith Pumping Station (PS)    Following the recent rainfall, Hammersmith Pumping Station discharged untreated sewage into the River Thames at 23:45hrs 03/10/20 , due to lack of capacity in the existing sewer network.      Tideway,‚Ä¶

Listen to my interview with @AmosAnnabel on @BBCNorthampton this morning RE the traveller encampment at Pineham Locks. 

The clean up operation now begins. I'll be working closely with Cllr @pinder_chauhan, @NorthamptonBC & @EnvAgency to ensure rubbish is cleared from the site.üëç https://t.co/vWbn4lLZKZ

We've been out all week, making sure rivers are flowing as they should be, removing any debris...

...all of which reduces flood-risk...

Like ‚¨áÔ∏è at #Beckenham in south-east London...

If YOU see obstructions in rivers, do please call us: 0800 807060... #floodaware https://t.co/yOEPobst90
One of my favourite places. A pool in the wonderful River Sawdde. @EnvAgency @WestWalesRT https://t.co/sLSbR7YOCC

@GavinTabinerEA @EnvAgencyYNE Definitely, Gav. Would rather have been asleep, but better checking remotely, rather than waking our operatives up too.  They can rest in case they‚Äôre needed elsewhere! üëçüèª

@EnvAgency Except they often fail!! No alert yet and my village is about to be cut off. We rely on phone and text alerts especially for overnight flooding but still haven‚Äôt received anything, it‚Äôs 8:15 and the river broke the banks at 6:30. Same thing happened during big flood March 2016. https://t.co/GZDANnUIZc

tweets.text: A flood alongside Covid-19 is a multi-hazard scenario, and  is entirely foreseeable, the flood response/recovery info provides no comment on this. Arguably dealing with acute (flood) impacts comes before chronic risks. But clarity of public guidance is needed @EnvAgency @bathnes

tweets.text:
Our Field Teams have been working through the night to keep our communities safe from #flood risk. 

As this graph from Morris Brook shows, clearing debris from watercourses drops levels significantly. You can see when the teams attended & cleared the screen as water levels fall https://t.co/BvaJoFLdM0
@PaulStockhillEA @EnvAgencyYNE CCTV on our assets is a great addition of the past few years I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôd agree @PaulStockhillEA

Good to see Cheltenham‚Äôs flood defences in action at Cox‚Äôs  Meadow, flumes and all! Very long way to go before it all fills up but more water than I‚Äôve seen in a while. ‚Å¶@EnvAgency‚Å© ‚Å¶@CheltenhamBC‚Å© ‚Å¶@cheltlibdems‚Å© https://t.co/Y3eTIv42o3

Field teams are on the ground again today checking structures and clearing trash screens etc. We are also proactively managing flows on the Parrett by using Monksleaze Clyse and the Sowy system. @EnvAgencySW @GaryBCutts https://t.co/9wkmpRSEs2
@carpenterjc @thameswater @BBCOxford @oxfordtimes @EnvAgency Yes. All that sewage heading straight to the river. So what are we paying @thameswater for??? I want safe homes and a clean river ...
Chew Magna at risk of flood impacts on Sunday 4.10.20. Whilst the village has benefitted from significant flood resilience investment, flooding still brings impact. https://t.co/O06pjIb7ze
